alert.note: Alert for Hancock; Harrison; Pearl River (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 06 at 1:25AM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern St. Bernard, northeastern Orleans and southeastern St. Tammany Parishes, western Harrison, Hancock and southeastern Pearl River Counties through 230 AM CDT... At 122 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms capable of producing strong wind gusts is along a line extending from near Picayune to 7 miles south of Lake Catherine. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Waterspouts along coastal areas, wind gusts up to 50 mph, and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Waterspouts can easily overturn boats and create locally hazardous waters. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... New Orleans, Slidell, Long Beach, Picayune, Bay St. Louis, Waveland, Diamondhead, Pearl River, Lake Catherine, Violet, Kiln, Pearlington, Lyman, Shoreline Park, Poydras, Stennis Space Center, Saucier, Shell Beach and Meraux. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 261 and 273. Interstate 10 in Mississippi between mile markers 1 and 31. Interstate 12 near mile marker 84. Interstate 59 in Louisiana between mile markers 1 and 3, and near mile marker 11. Interstate 59 in Mississippi between mile markers 1 and 16. WATERSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
